intro: Draba alpina var. korshinskyi, commonly known as the Korshinsky's rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 centimeters. This variety is characterized by its dense, basal rosette of leaves and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is native to Central Asia and is often found in mountainous regions of Kazakhstan and southern Siberia.
